Left canal wall down tympanomastoidectom.context: Left canal wall down tympanomastoidectomy with ossicular chain reconstruction, microdissection, NIM facial nerve monitoring for three hours.

extremely large canal cholesteatoma.context: There is an extremely large canal cholesteatoma, which eroded most of the posterior and superior canal wall.

myringosclerosis.context: There was a significant amount of myringosclerosis and tympanosclerosis.

tympanosclerosis.context: There was also a large focus of tympanosclerosis between the stapes crura, which was impinging the ability of the stapes to move.

mild erosion of the lenticular process o.context: There is some mild erosion of the lenticular process of the incus.

removed the incus.context: We removed the incus, removed the head of the malleus, and placed a titanium-PORP from the stapes capitulum to a cartilage graft.

removed the head of the malleus.context: We removed the incus, removed the head of the malleus, and placed a titanium-PORP from the stapes capitulum to a cartilage graft.

placed a titanium-PORP.context: We removed the incus, removed the head of the malleus, and placed a titanium-PORP from the stapes capitulum to a cartilage graft.

cartilage graft.context: We removed the incus, removed the head of the malleus, and placed a titanium-PORP from the stapes capitulum to a cartilage graft.

NIM facial nerve monitoring for three ho.context: Left canal wall down tympanomastoidectomy with ossicular chain reconstruction, microdissection, NIM facial nerve monitoring for three hours.

microdissection.context: Left canal wall down tympanomastoidectomy with ossicular chain reconstruction, microdissection, NIM facial nerve monitoring for three hours.

ear canal.context: We inspected the ear canal, identified the huge defect, which was completely filled with cerumen.

huge defect.context: We inspected the ear canal, identified the huge defect, which was completely filled with cerumen.

cerumen.context: We inspected the ear canal, identified the huge defect, which was completely filled with cerumen.

prepped and draped the ear in a sterile.context: We prepped and draped the ear in a sterile fashion.

reflected the soft tissues anteriorly.context: We reflected the soft tissues anteriorly to the level of the ear canal and identified where the ear canal skin entered the defect in the mastoid bone.

mastoid cortex.context: We drilled down the mastoid cortex and identified this cholesteatoma which was then carefully dissected out.

cholesteatoma.context: We drilled down the mastoid cortex and identified this cholesteatoma which was then carefully dissected out.

mastoid antrum.context: We went all the way to the mastoid antrum.

tegmen.context: We finished a complete mastoidectomy with identification of the tegmen, sigmoid sinus.

sigmoid sinus.context: We finished a complete mastoidectomy with identification of the tegmen, sigmoid sinus.

lateral aspect of the mastoid tip.context: We removed the lateral aspect of the mastoid tip.

incudostapedial joint.context: The incudostapedial joint was already membranous in nature, we went ahead and used the joint knife and removed the incus.

incus.context: The incudostapedial joint was already membranous in nature, we went ahead and used the joint knife and removed the incus.

malleus head nipper.context: We used a malleus head nipper to remove the head of the malleus and then we continued to saucerize the entire mastoid cavity.

head of the malleus.context: We used a malleus head nipper to remove the head of the malleus and then we continued to saucerize the entire mastoid cavity.

saucerize the entire mastoid cavity.context: We used a malleus head nipper to remove the head of the malleus and then we continued to saucerize the entire mastoid cavity.

middle ear space.context: There was no cholesteatoma within the middle ear space, but there was roughly 40% surface area perforation.

40% surface area perforation.context: There was no cholesteatoma within the middle ear space, but there was roughly 40% surface area perforation.

remaining portion of the tympanic membra.context: The remaining portion of the tympanic membrane was extremely calcified and myringosclerotic; this was removed.

myringosclerotic.context: The remaining portion of the tympanic membrane was extremely calcified and myringosclerotic; this was removed.

stapes crura.context: There was also a large focus of tympanosclerosis between the stapes crura, which was impinging the ability of the stapes to move.

stapes to move.context: There was also a large focus of tympanosclerosis between the stapes crura, which was impinging the ability of the stapes to move.

temporalis fascia.context: We harvested a few pieces as best as we could.

previous tympanoplasty.context: He had already had a previous tympanoplasty, but even outside the areas where the graft was taken, the temporalis muscle was quite atrophied and lumpy, and I suspect this was due to his chronic disease and long history of corticosteroid usage.

chronic disease.context: He had already had a previous tympanoplasty, but even outside the areas where the graft was taken, the temporalis muscle was quite atrophied and lumpy, and I suspect this was due to his chronic disease and long history of corticosteroid usage.

corticosteroid usage.context: He had already had a previous tympanoplasty, but even outside the areas where the graft was taken, the temporalis muscle was quite atrophied and lumpy, and I suspect this was due to his chronic disease and long history of corticosteroid usage.

cartilage tympanoplasty.context: We placed some Gelfoam in the middle ear space and placed the cartilage on the top of it.

Gelfoam.context: We placed some Gelfoam in the middle ear space and placed the cartilage on the top of it.

titanium-PORP.context: We cut a titanium-PORP of the proper side and placed on top of the stapes capitulum to interface with the cartilage cap.

stapes capitulum.context: We cut a titanium-PORP of the proper side and placed on top of the stapes capitulum to interface with the cartilage cap.

cartilage cap.context: We cut a titanium-PORP of the proper side and placed on top of the stapes capitulum to interface with the cartilage cap.

ear canal and tympanic membrane remnants.context: We placed a few other small pieces of temporalis fascia were used to bulge through the surrounding edges of the cartilage and make sure that it was medial to any remnant of ear canal and tympanic membrane remnants.

Gelfoam lateral to the graft.context: We placed a layer of Gelfoam lateral to the graft, closed the postauricular incision in layers and put 2 Merocel packs in the ear.

Merocel packs.context: We placed a layer of Gelfoam lateral to the graft, closed the postauricular incision in layers and put 2 Merocel packs in the ear.

Glasscock dressing.context: The patient was awakened from anesthesia and taken to the recovery room in stable condition. He will be given antibiotics and pain medicines and he will be given instructions to follow up with me in one week.
